msIdentifier.repository: Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi) , Istanbul

summary.p: 18 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: E. H. 31; Text: Q 2:16-27, Q 2:159-234; 14 lines per page; Dimensions: 408 x 325 mm; Script style: kūfī; Estimated date of production: 2nd (8th) to 3rd (9th) centuries [according to Karatay].

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 14: "37 E. H. 31 Kur’an’dan parça Parşömen. 325mm boy ve 408mm eninde cönk biçiminde 18 yaprak. Sahifede kûfî ile 320mm uzunl.[uğunda] 14 satır. Tahminen II-III. (VIII-IX) asırda istinsah edilmiştir. Miklepli siyah deri üzerine yapıştırma şemse ve köşelikli Osmanlı cildi. Kapakların içinde de şemseler vardır. Bu parça Baḳara (2) suresinin 173. ayetinin غير باغ kelimesinden aynı surenin 234. ayetinin وعشرا kelimesine kadar; Y. 15a da aynı surenin 16. ayetinin بالهدى kelimesinden ayni surenin 27. ayetinin يفسدون في الأرض ibaresine kadar; Y. 17a aynı surenin 159. ayetinin son kelimesi ile başlayıp ve 173. ayetine فمن اضطر cümlesiyle sona erer."

This can be translated as follows: "37 E. H. 31 Fragment of the Qurʾān Parchment. 18 junk shaped leaves of 325 mm height and 408 mm width. The text area written in Kufic script [contains] 14 lines measuring 320 mm. Probably copied during 2nd-3rd (8th-9th) centuries. Ottoman black leather binding with flap (miklep), attached mandorla (yapıştırma şemse [= A type of mandorla with a mold printed on it after the gold is attached]) and book edges. There are also mandorlas inside the covers. This fragment begins with the words غير باغ of Q 2:173 (Sūra al-Baqara) and continues until the word وعشرا of verse 234 of the same sūra. L. 15a is from the word بالهدى of verse 16 until the words يفسدون في الأرض of verse 27of the same sūra. L. 17a begins with the last word of verse 159 of the same sūra and ends with the words فمن اضطر of verse 173."
